meanings.definition: A person who lacks courage or is easily intimidated.
meanings.sent1: Tommy was such a woose that he always avoided confrontations.
meanings.sent2: The woose hesitated to speak up during the scary movie.
meanings.sent3: The little woose mouse was scared of its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The woose in the story finally found their bravery when it mattered most.
meanings.sent5: Don't be a woose, stand up for what you believe in!

meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly or timid manner.
meanings.sent1: She woose around whenever she had to face a difficult situation.
meanings.sent2: Don't woose out now, you can do it!
meanings.sent3: The cat woosingly tiptoed around the puddle, afraid to get its paws wet.
meanings.sent4: He woosed his way out of taking responsibility for his actions.
meanings.sent5: The team cannot afford to woose during the final moments of the game.
